name: Ithaca Community Gardens
description: The Ithaca Community Gardens is a not-for-profit membership organization devoted to furthering community food self-sufficiency.

name: Floral Avenue Community Garden
description: Floral Avenue Community Garden on Ithacaâ€™s west side was started in 2014 with a Hunger and Food Security grant from the United Way of Tompkins County.

name: West Hill Community Garden
description: Built on a generous tract of land belonging to the Town of Ithaca, West Hill Community Garden comprises over 75 plots that are available to anyone in the local community.

name: Community Gardens at Cornell
description: Plots are available to Cornell students, members of the Cornell community, and area residents. Plots are available to Cornell students, members of the Cornell community, and area residents.

name: East Shore Community Garden
description: East Shore Community garden offers individual plots as well as a community section where we grow squash, cucumbers, corn, etc.

name: Common Field Garden
description: Land available for gardening. Plot sizes are flexible depending on what you need. No running water, but pond and stream nearby. Bring your own tools, etc.

name: Esty Street Neighborhood Garden
description: Located in a lot next to the Meadow Street branch of CFCU Community Credit Union, the Esty Street Neighborhood Garden was begun in August 2017 with assistance assistance from Cornell Cooperative Extension Tompkins County, Greenstar Community Projects, volunteers from Ithaca Children's Garden and Loaves and Fishes.

name: Danby Community Church Garden
description: A new garden based out of the Danby Community Church open to everyone in the community. Actively seeking volunteers.
